Text:
Cid Kagenou—nothing about him is all that striking.
He is a student at Midgar Academy for Dark Knights.
A flawed boy who always looks out for number one.

That's right...with no signs of trouble down the line,
he makes a perfect man-deterrent. I'm certain that
he'll faithfully play the role of my boyfriend.

Though he does have some rebellious tendencies,
he cannot defy the authority of Midgar Kingdom's
princess...or cash, most of all. He's my Pooch—
A dog.

Oh, Pooch. Poochie... Hehe, a great name, if I do say
so myself. He's my loyal doggie.
Well, let's go visit my Pooch again today. Teehee.
After school...

Would you mind joining me for a bit? You've got
nothing do do after this, right?
Rude. You're just assuming I have nothing to do.

Oh, so you're telling me you got something that's a
higher priority than being with me?
I'm hanging out with my friends today. Laters.
Sooo...is what he said true?
I ask Cid's two friends about it.
Pwinshesh Alexia! B-By all means, take him with you.
Hehh?!

Huh? Funny, I don't remember making any plans to hang
out with Cid today.

Nah, I don't remember either. So anyway...please
have your way with Cid.

See? Your friends are giving you a warm send-off.
Looks like you're all clear.
You...filthy traitors.
Come on, stop spacing out. Let's go.

Despite what those idiots said just now, I know
they're gonna be so salty later...

What are you grumbling about. I have no interest in
your friendship dynamics whatsoever.

More importantly... It seems you were planning on a
stealthy walk home from school to avoid my noticing.
Did you really think you could get away with it?

I am under no obligation to hang out with you after
school.

Don't be silly. We're dating—that means we hang out
after school. Going on dates in our school uniforms
is par for the course.
Well, yeah...if we really were dating.
Hey. I don't like your tone.

It seems you still don't fully get what your role
is here. I don't mind explaining it to you again...

I'm just supposed to pretend to be your boyfriend,
right? As a deterrent to ward off Zenon.
Oh, so you do understand. Good boy, Pooch.

But you see...understanding means nothing if you
don't follow through with your actions.

I'm playing the part of your boyfriend well at
school. Though, kinda reluctantly.

Yes, you do play the part well when we're at school.
But you never know when somebody's watching.
You need to be my boyfriend always.

I hope you're not sayin' I gotta stay with you all
day every day...

Only when I order you to. You should be grateful that
I don't demand your services 24/7—see how kind I am?
Yeah, yeah...

Well! Let's treat ourselves with a nice afterschool
date. I trust you'll treat me like a proper lady?
You are my boyfriend, after all.

Ah...I just remembered. I've got a swordplay test
tomorrow. I've gotta get right home to practice!

Funny. We're in the same swordplay class, yet this is
the first I've heard of such a test.

W-Well, it's because you're gifted, Alexia! You don't
have to take the test! Compared to you, I'm so—
Please, stop. It's painfully obvious you're lying.

R-Right! It wasn't a test—it's homework. I have to
read an assignment and write a report by tomorrow.
Oh, man, I'm definitely pulling an all-nighter—

Oh dear, that sounds terrible. You have my sympathies.
What a cruel teacher, to assign you such crazy homework.

Right? But no matter how cruel my teacher is,
I just can't skip on the homework.

Well! I guess I better get going then. Ohhh, I'm so
super-busy.
So. Which teacher assigned you that homework?
Huh?

Did you not hear me? I'm asking you to tell me which
teacher assigned you that homework.

And then I am going to ask them to extend your
deadline.

Look at me, extending a helping hand to ease my
boyfriend's suffering over homework—I'm so kind!

Urk...w-well, I couldn't make you do all that for me.
I need to do my own homework!

But I'm the princess of this kingdom. My commands...
That is, my requests, cannot be denied by any teacher.
So please, don't be shy.

R-Right...actually it's my sister. I just got word
she's in the hospital!

Oh, but I just saw your sister a couple minutes ago
when I was leaving class. She looked well—perhaps
I was imagining it.
U-Urrrk...

Have you run out of excuses? Well, even if any of
them were true, my commands would still have
priority.
I-I'm busy—

Oh, you're such an annoying boy. Here. Now you've
nothing to complain about.
Oof!

As I look down at my Pooch and watch him scramble to
pick up the coins off the ground, a proud smile fills my
face. I win.

(He really does have a simple personality. That's why
it's easy for me to get him to obey.)
There. Now will you obey me?
Of course, princess!
Good boy, Pooch. Okay...give paw.
Woof!
Cid rests his hand on top of Alexia's.

When I say give paw you hold my hand. We're dating...
most people who date hold hands.
Jeez...you're just so simpleminded. Come on, hurry.

Well, excuse me for being simpleminded. Sorry, but I
don't understand at all how to treat a lady—

Before Cid can finish his sentence, I toss another
coin into the air.
Woof, woof!

It sounded like you were saying something—was it just
my imagination?

Yes, I suppose it was. My Pooch would never go
against my commands.

Of course I wouldn't! It will be my pleasure to treat
you like a lady! Come, Pwinshesh, your hand.
*sigh*... It's all cash with you.
Well, no matter. Let's start our afterschool date.

Let me see...why don't we go get some street food?
Let's get going.
Woof!
You could try answering me like a normal person!
